newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds closed a little higher, after lingering in positive territory all day.
Dealers said business could get more volatile in the near term as investors remained nervous and disinclined to buy.

"If the (June) bund future contracts drop below 110.25 this would turn the whole market bearish," said one dealer, noting that the future contracts had started to drop in the middle of the afternoon and recovered later.
Dealers said there was already some buying interest for the Dutch government's 5.75 percent bond due February 2007, which will be reopened for sale from Tuesday.
Grey market prices were quoted around 99.25/60 in late afternoon versus 99.40/60 in the morning.
The original 5.75 percent February 2007 bond closed at 99.72/80, yielding 5.78 percent.
Dealers said that business would be calm at the start of next week as many market players might be away for an ISMA meeting in Singapore.
